comment: Lingering. Can tell it’s a sherry cask
Tasted at Whiskey Obsession 2018. Not bad for a young whippersnapper. Cream notes, lightly smoky.

We rented the distillery for an after hours private tour.  We sampled every one of the products (11 in all) except for the Dark Arts Single Malt Whiskey.  This was by far my favorite product.  I already enjoyed their bourbon, and the PX Sherry casks just smooth it out a touch more and give it a nice fruity smell.
Little bit of spice, but not too offensive.
Definitely Sherry on the nose and sweet. Get a bit of spice and the expected sherry taste, but something with the after taste seems off.

smells akin to a cask strength but extra-sweet Blanton's. served neat it tastes like it needs 2years to age. on the rocks it sweetens up and rose and wood notes pop on the nose. wood, rose and vanilla finish

Nose is sweet with hints of spice.

Taste blossoms with lots of spice and light sweetness, paired with a moderate burn.
One of the best from Breckenridge a little fruitier than expected, but not too sweet. It has a nice spicy balance to off set the sweet. A true Colorado experience.
This blend is very tasty. A little sweet, a little smoky, you won’t go wrong with this a a sipper. My bottle was Batch 2 and I will get another couple for special occasions.
Too much going on. Not my jam.

Spicy at the beginning, scotch-like smoke, oak, with a long smooth finish. It feels and tastes like a higher proof than 90. On the nose I get the spice followed with some sweeter notes almost like cake.
Quick Hit: Bananas and caramel nose. Bitter, spice, vanilla. Wood spicy finish.  Nose is the best part of the whiskey.
Fantastic Sherry peanut nose, palate is more Sherry & roasted nuts on the front but very sharp & young on the back end. The finish mellows & lingers sweetly.
Nose is sweet. Just a hint of bananas. Pallet is spicy and earthy with just a bit of burn.
Easy drinking, smooth and sweet. Makes a nice bourbon Manhattan. Not as much a sherry note as expected with PX finishing.

Tasted at NWB on 12/19/18

Bourbon mash bill did not blend wth sherry finish. The two flavors seemed to be at odds with one another.
Finished a half bottle in one sitting while on a zoom call during the quarantine. Time flys when youre drinking something GOOD!
Warm red fruit notes to start, with lingering oak and leather. Very oily from start to finish.

Flaviar

N: Bright, sherry?, light malt?
P: Sweet front, sour back. Wood?
F: Medium/Long

Closest bourbon to a scotch I’ve had.

Vanilla and orange with spice on the nose. Trade is orange zest, slight spice and pepper, oak (bark), very cherry on the finish with brown sugar sweetness.
Finish is quick and sharp sweet cherry. Almost astringent bitterness that continues to build. This is similar to the bitter part of pecans. Overall, this is like drinking am old fashion with a bitter pecan finish.
A little sweet and goes down nicely. Definatley will look for other bottles from Breckenridge after trying this one.
One of my favorite flavor profiles to this point! Well balanced and oaky with a hint of sherry sweetness!

Tried in an Old Fashioned- A lemon zest discard, along with a traditional orange zest, is welcome here. The citrus sits very well on the rich, round character of the PX Sherry. After dilution, there is no doubt about the chocolate after taste.
A little aftertaste (spicy) but past sip able to drinkable.
